group_1.narration: I came across an article@on the "Kamihama Journal" website
alleging that if one stands before the Chuo Ward radio tower@and prays for 20 minutes on the night of February 14th,@their apologies to their loved ones are sure to succeed.
It may be a mere, baseless rumor, and yet there are those@who are desperate to believe it nevertheless...

group_1.textRight: So it is...!@[chara:101851:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:101851:cheek_0][chara:101851:face_mtn_ex_011.exp.json][chara:101851:lipSynch_1]Good evening, Rena.
Is something the matter?@Might it be a stomachache?
[chara:100952:effect_shake]Rena? Rena!

group_1.textLeft: I'm in the middle of praying, here!

group_1.textRight: Praying...? Are you referring to the article in the Kamihama Journal?

group_1.textLeft: Wait, you knew about it too?! @You knew about it and you interrupted me anyway?!

group_1.textRight: I hadn't realized it was such a well-known rumor...
Are you looking to apologize to someone?
Indeed.@I need to apologize to Tsukasa.
We had planned on enjoying Valentine's Day @together.
Unfortunately, my attempts to make homemade chocolate were quite unsatisfactory,
and I told Tsukasa that I did not wish to see her @today...
As a result, I hurt her.
But truly, I only said that because my failures had frustrated me so...

group_1.textLeft: ...Well, making chocolates by hand is surprisingly @tough.
People think it's just about melting it and letting it @cool, but nopeâ€” big mistake!

group_1.textRight: *Giggle* Thank you for your sympathy.
Even so, it does not change the fact that I hurt @Tsukasa, who did nothing wrong...
...So what brought you here, Rena?

group_1.textLeft: I met Kaede at school today.
I couldn't bring myself to give her my chocolate.

group_1.textRight: I see...@I'm sorry to hear that.

group_1.textLeft: Kaede gave some to me, @[chara:100952:lipSynch_0][wait:1.0][chara:100952:cheek_1][chara:100952:eyeClose_1][chara:100952:lipSynch_1]but I was so embarassed...
So I snapped at her and said I didn't bring her @anything.

group_1.textRight: Giving chocolate to those you care about... requires @much more courage than one would ever expect.
We're in the same boat, then.
...I want to apologize to her.
Let us pray, then.
Tsukasa?!@How did you get here?!
You shouldn't expect anything less from your twin, Tsukuyo!
It was a little shocking when you said you didn't @want to see me,
but I know you just blurted it out without @meaning it.
I had a feeling you were looking for some way to apologize right now,
so I came here.
I read about this ritual in the Kamihama Journal, @too, so I'm ready for your apology!
We're just the same, Rena! @I can see right through you, too!

group_1.textLeft: You aren't anywhere close to being my twin, though!@You're a year younger than me!

group_1.textRight: Aww...

group_1.textLeft: ...No, this isn't what I came to do...@I'm here to apologize.
I'm sorry about what happened during lunch,
and telling you I didn't bring any chocolate for you.

group_1.textRight: You were being dramatic back there, but it's @all good. I forgive you.

group_1.textLeft: Tsukasa... I deeply apologize for saying I didn't want @to see you.

group_1.textRight: Yes!@You apologized!
Valentine's Day might be a big deal, but you're @taking it way too seriously.
No matter what, I'll be thrilled with anything I get @from you. It doesn't have to be perfect.
So go easier on yourself, okay?
Yeah, that's enough apologizing!@I want your chocolate, Rena!

group_1.textLeft: W-well, I've been lugging this around all day, @anyway, so...

group_1.textRight: Rena, you know...@I wasn't really after the chocolate.
I just want you to be more honest, alright?
Yes, exactly!
That's right!
Be easier on myself...
